column4: They work fine for me.. but every couple of reboots they hang on the glx module
oh really? then why isn't jessids computer working?
have you experienced the same problem as him? no? then stfu
the packaged nvidia drivers ARE OLD
I can almost garuntee it will fix his problem, because I had the exact same problem.. and it took me like a week with the help of people in this channel to figure it out
backporting a driver?... "waves his hand over his head"

like you said before... whats the point in getting someone to do something complicated like that when nvidias website has simple instructions on how to install the newest drivers with one command that will fix the problem?...
simple solution for a simple problem...
are you trying to say that the newest nvidia drivers are going to scerw his system... both you and I know that's a fallacy

I see your point yes, but however your solution of installing backported drivers isn't even proven to work.  You're saying my solution is flawed, I'm challenging that your solution wouldn't even work.
also if he were wanting to upgrade his drivers in the future the easiest option is to get them straight from nvidia instead of waiting weeks for the repositories to be updated
how abot you go hold his hand through it and prove me wrong :P
I just mean that I can't map port 5900 to port 5901 on the router
